required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Muscle Property, Alignment and Joint Loading in People With Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: External Tibia Torsion and Passive Muscle Stiffness of Quadriceps as Two Important Contributors of Joint Loading During Walking in People With Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: Knee osteoarthritis (KOA) is a common chronic painful musculoskeletal condition among older adults. It poses great challenge to the health care system due to its inability to be cured. Understanding factors associated with disease progression in KOA should assist the development of novel prevention/rehabilitation strategies. This study investigate factors including muscle properties, lower limb alignment and joint loading in patients with knee osteoarthritis before and after a six-week exercise program.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of External Knee Adduction Moment as Assessed by Visual Motion Analysis System
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and one week after intervention
primary_outcome.description: External knee moment in the frontal plane during early stance phase of walking

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Pain Severity Score as Assessed by Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and one week after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity measured by the pain subscale of Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS). The minimum value is 0 and maximum value is 100. The higher scores mean a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tibial Torsion as Assessed by X-ray Imaging
secondary_outcome.description: The angle between tibial and femur in the transverse plane

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Young's Modulus of Quadriceps as Assessed by Ultrasound Elastography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and one week after intervention

arm_group.description: Six-week exercise including stretching, strengthening, endurance and gait modification

intervention.description: Comprehensive exercise program including strengthening, stretching, gait modification etc.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age between 50-80
2. having radiographic tibiofemoral joint OA in the medial compartment defined as Kellgren and Lawrence grade = 2 to 3
3. having medial knee pain on most days of the month
4. having a minimum average pain score of 2 on an 11-point numerical rating scale in the past week while walking
Exclusion Criteria:
1. having lateral tibiofemoral compartment osteophytes greater than the medial side.
2. having undergone intra-articular corticosteroid injection or knee surgery to either knee within the past 3 months
3. having a systemic arthritic condition (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis)
4. having a knee joint replacement or high tibial osteotomy in the past
5. having any other muscular, joint or neurological condition influencing lower limb function
6. unable to walk unaided
7. having low back, hip, ankle or foot pain > 3 on numerical rating scale
8. having a body mass index (BMI) >36 kg/ m2

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
